鄧世昌.definition: Deng Shichang (1849-1894), Qing dynasty naval specialist, founded naval dockyards and two naval colleges, died heroically in action against the Japanese

鄧亞萍.definition: Deng Yaping (1973-), table tennis player, several times world and Olympic winner

鄧亮洪.definition: Tang Liang Hong (opposition candidate in Jan 1996 Singapore elections)

鄧小平.definition: Deng Xiaoping (1904-1997), Chinese communist leader, de facto leader of PRC 1978-1990 and creator of "socialism with Chinese characteristics"

鄧小平理論.definition: Deng Xiaoping Theory; Dengism; the foundation of PRC economic development after the Cultural Revolution, building the capitalist economy within Chinese Communist Party control

鄧州.definition: see 鄧州市|邓州市[Deng4zhou1 Shi4]

鄧州市.definition: Dengzhou, county-level city in Nanyang 南陽市|南阳市[Nan2yang2 Shi4], Henan

鄧拓.definition: Deng Tuo (1912-1966), sociologist and journalist, died under persecution at the start of the Cultural Revolution; wrote under the pen name Ma Nancun 馬南邨|马南邨

鄧析.definition: Deng Xi (545-501 BC), Chinese philosopher and rhetorician, the first lawyer of ancient China

鄧穎超.definition: Deng Yingchao (1904-1992), Chinese communist leader, wife of Zhou Enlai 周恩來|周恩来

鄧通.definition: Deng Tong (2nd c. BC), one of the wealthiest Former Han Dynasty 前漢|前汉[Qian2 Han4] officials
